data.name: Apartment rent for the couple.
data.description:
A couple is looking for a new apartment in a building that has 20 floors. But the real estate agent only told them the rent of the apartment on the top floor. And said that the cost of apartment increases 200$ for each floor as we move down. For example: if the rent on 20th floor is 1000$ then rent on 19th will be 1200$, 18th floor will be 1400$ and so on... Make a function which on providing the top floor price and desired floor, returns the rent on desired floor. (The FloorWanted (f) is between 1 and 20 and values passed in rent (r) will be always be non-negative and valid, so you don't have to check for that) *Note that our building follows US English Floor counting ie. bottommost floor is First floor not ground floor. https://images.app.goo.gl/MKExuaL29Aacyife7

Examples:

floor_rent(1000, 5) --> '4000 Dollars' floor_rent(850, 11) --> '2650 Dollars' floor_rent(500, 7) --> '3100 Dollars'
